math::float4x4 Class Reference
[Mathematical support classes]

#include <float4x4.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

4x4 column-major matrix of scalar type float.

NOTE: The class behaves like C basic types what it comes to initialization so default constructor leaves the components to unspecified value. Alerting user is the reason also for that the name starts with lower-case letter.

const float3 &  n,
const float3 &  p
) 
 

Matrix projects points to the plane along lines parallel to specified direction.

Parameters:
l Projection direction.
n Normal of the projection plane.
p Point on the projection plane.

void math::float4x4::setInverseOrthonormalTransform (  const float3x3 &  rot,
const float3 &  t
) 
 

Sets this matrix as inverse transform of float4x4(rot,t).

Assumes that the matrix is orthonormal.

void math::float4x4::setPerspectiveProjection (  float  fovHorz,
float  front,
float  back,
float  aspect
) 
 

Left handed perspective projection matrix.

Parameters:
fovHorz Horizontal field of view in radians.
front Front plane distance.
back Back plane distance.
aspect Viewport width divided by height.

void math::float4x4::setPointPlaneProjection (  const float3 &  l,
const float3 &  n,
const float3 &  p
) 
 

Matrix projects points to the plane along the line from the projection origin to the point to be projected.

Parameters:
l Projection origin.
n Normal of the projection plane.
p Point on the projection plane.

void math::float4x4::setRotation (  const math::float3 &  axis,
float  angle
) 
 

Sets top-left 3x3 submatrix as angle/axis rotation.

Parameters:
axis Axis of rotation.
angle Angle in radians.

void math::float4x4::setScreenTransform (  float  screenz,
float  scalex,
float  scaley,
float  zmin,
float  zmax,
float  cx,
float  cy
) 
 

Projection matrix to screen space transformation matrix.

Parameters:
screenz Screen distance in Z-buffer coordinates.
scalex X-axis relative scale [0,1].
scaley Y-axis relative scale [0,1].
zmin Z-buffer value on near plane.
zmax Z-buffer value on far plane.
cx X-axis origin in screen space.
cy Y-axis origin in screen space.
